title: Wealth Management Summer Intern
requirements:
PROGRAM DESCRIPTION: At Morgan Stanley, we know that the diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. We strive to build an organization that is diverse in experience and background, reflecting our standards of integrity and excellence. Our Pathways Summer Internship Program is an integral part of our long-term diversity recruiting strategy, open to outstanding rising junior and seniors.

During this 10-week internship, you’ll work side-by-side with a successful, established FA Advisory team. The program includes course work in industry and product-specific training, an overview of wealth management and the roles within, and an overall education about the depth and breadth of Morgan Stanley’s platform and capabilities. Throughout the program, Associates will share experiences with a virtual cohort community, participate in weekly mentoring and learning sessions, and add value through their unique perspective and strong academic background.

Pathways Summer Associate opportunities are available for students in various branches located throughout the Great Lakes Region of Morgan Stanley Wealth Management.

DUTIES And RESPONSIBILITIES
Assist in sales and operation functions to streamline processes and strengthen the client experience.
Learn how Financial Advisors identify new opportunities and develop client relationships.
Support Branch Management and attend branch meetings and events.
Establish a strong FA team marketing presence, including digital and print assets, website optimization, social media campaigns and niche target market outreach.
Perform market research and analyze financial data for client portfolios.
Complete special projects designed to build WM capabilities, client experiences and office operations.
Learn about various departments within Morgan Stanley and the role they play in achieving the organizations goals.


Qualifications/Skills/Requirements
Applicants must be in their sophomore or junior year at a 4-year accredited college or university.
Minimum GPA of 3.0.
Strong desire to gain further understanding of the global wealth management business.
Basic knowledge and a keen interest in finance.
Marketing expertise preferred.
An ability to understand and interpret numeric data.
Effective written and oral communication and interpersonal skills.
Demonstrates leadership abilities.
Self-starter with an entrepreneurial spirit
The ability to collaborate and work effectively on a team.


Posting Date

Feb 5, 2021

Primary Location

Americas-United States of America-Illinois-Chicago

Job

Wealth Management

Employment Type

Intern

Job Level

Non-Exempt

title: Wealth Management Branch Intern
requirements:
Job Reference #
225487BR

City
Fort Collins, United States - Colorado

Job Type
Full Time

Your role
Are you a motivated self-starter? Can you take an assignment and run with it? If you're ready to dive into a fast-paced, client-focused work environment, an internship may be the right fit for you.

We're looking for an intern to:

work on projects that have real impact on clients
support our team of wealth management experts
gain product knowledge from internal and external partner sessions to support your team
plan team marketing events and material
assist with the responsibilities of running an entrepreneurial business model

We welcome interns to become a part of our team. You will work with our experts and learn about the industry, our clients and our firm. This is an opportunity to gain valuable insight, develop new skills, and establish a network of mentors and business contacts. You'll leave with a lot more than a job listing on your resume.

Your team
You’ll be working within a WMA branch office where we provide advice-based solutions. Our financial
advisors deliver a fully integrated set of products and services specifically designed to address the needs of
ultra-high net worth and high-net worth individuals and families.

The base rate of pay offered for this role is $20.00/hour.

Your expertise

at least a 3.2 GPA
a balanced resume which includes solid academic performance and campus involvement
a genuine interest in developing a career in Wealth Management
positive with a can-do approach
analyze a problem, come up with ideas and make a decision
show good judgment
a planner; organized and can make things happen
communicate well and work within a team
able to stick with a task

Have you participated in teams sports? Organized a volunteer project? Taken a challenging class and aced it?
Think about your achievements and how they match the skills we’re after.

About Us
Expert advice. Wealth management. Investment banking. Asset management. Retail banking in Switzerland. And all the support functions. That's what we do. And we do it for private and institutional clients as well as corporations around the world.

We are about 60,000 employees in all major financial centers, in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?

Join us
We're a truly global, collaborative and friendly group of people. Having a diverse, inclusive and respectful workplace is important to us. And we support your career development, internal mobility and work-life balance. If this sounds interesting, apply now.

Disclaimer / Policy Statements
UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.

title: Internship - Private Wealth Management (Anchorage, AK Summer 2021)
requirements:
Challenge your thinking and build an amazing career with the best people in the financial services industry! Baird’s Financial Advisors provide advice, strategies, and solutions to high-net worth individuals and families across the United States, serving as true partners. True wealth management goes beyond managing investments. At Baird, we understand it begins with learning all we can about what our clients want for themselves and their families. We work closely with them to prioritize their goals, utilizing Baird’s resources and expertise to create a tailored plan to ensure success as they’ve defined it. Our 1,700+ private wealth associates serve clients coast-to-coast from 160 + locations in over 33 states. We have been recognized on Barron’s Top Wealth Management Firms for 10 consecutive years and hold over $200 billion in client assets. Check out this

Are you looking to gain real world experience in a thriving, global financial services firm with an award-winning culture? Consider an internship and start building your career at Baird!

About Our Intern Program

Our competitive intern program is a robust experience that offers interns exposure to the business world and a meaningful work experience. Interns are treated as valuable team members while learning from experienced professionals in a collaborative, fun, and dynamic environment. Baird’s summer program activities include an Intern Welcome Event in our corporate office in Milwaukee, multiple Lunch & Learns, and have the opportunity to use a Baird Cares Day and be compensated to volunteer in the community. They are also eligible to apply for scholarships. Our informal mentor program gives interns an opportunity to network throughout Baird and learn about all the areas of the firm.

About Our Private Wealth Management Business

Challenge your thinking and build an amazing career with the best people in the financial services industry! Baird’s Financial Advisors provide advice, strategies, and solutions to high-net worth individuals and families across the United States, serving as true partners. True wealth management goes beyond managing investments. At Baird, we understand it begins with learning all we can about what our clients want for themselves and their families. We work closely with them to prioritize their goals, utilizing Baird’s resources and expertise to create a tailored plan to ensure success as they’ve defined it. Our 1,700+ private wealth associates serve clients coast-to-coast from 90+ locations in 30 states. We have been recognized on Barron’s Top Wealth Management Firms for 10 consecutive years and hold over $305 billion in client assets. Check out this

Interns are treated as valuable team members and are challenged with meaningful work while learning from experienced professionals in a collaborative, fun, and dynamic environment. We look for highly motivated, detail-oriented individuals who are proactive, eager to learn and ready to contribute. Interns will gain first-hand experience into the day in the life of a successful Financial Advisor and their team.

Internship Location, Availability and Hours:

Located in our Anchorage office, interns must be able to work full time, 37.5 – 40 hours per week, during the summer.

As a Private Wealth Management Intern, You Will
Support various projects from Financial Advisors (i.e. review reports, research stocks, money managers and funds and investment strategies)
Process paperwork and documents necessary to assist others in the department, including opening new accounts for existing clients, death distributions, and trade corrections
Assist with administrative functions including answering phones and responding to basic client questions; Forwards more advanced calls to Client Specialists or Financial Advisors for handling
Prepare for client meetings and presentations
Create quarterly performance reports and distribute to clients
Conduct cost basis research
Perform additional duties and assist with projects as assigned

What We Look For
Pursuing a Bachelor’s degree in Finance, business or related degree preferred
Cumulative GPA of 3.0 or higher
Anticipated graduation date of December 2021 or later
Excellent customer service skills and exceptional telephone etiquette
Demonstrates a high level of professionalism and positive attitude
An interest in financial services and developing a career in wealth management
Prior office experience in a corporate or university setting preferred
Experience with the Microsoft Office package

What Makes This Opportunity Great
Gain first-hand experience into the day in the life of a successful Financial Advisor and their team
Apply knowledge gained in the classroom to develop relevant professional experience while developing meaningful relationships
Gain experience specifically in private wealth management, with the ability to be considered for full time opportunities post-graduation including our

title: Summer Internship – Private Banking Assistant
company: Societe Generale Corporate and Investment Banking - SGCIB
requirements:
Responsibilities

Description of the Business Line or Department

SG Kleinwort Hambros is a leading private banking and wealth management own by Société Générale that offers financial services in the UK, Channel Islands and Gibraltar.

Summary Of The Key Purposes Of The Role

The purpose of the Summer Intern role is to support the designated team that they are assigned to. The role will initially be to shadow colleagues within the team to gain a better understanding of how a Private Banking business operates and to understand the specialist nature of the function that the intern is aligned to.

The role will provide administration support, assist with adhoc projects, peer networking and undertake an interesting CSR (Corporate Social Responsibility) challenge with your peers. At the end of the Internship there may be longer term trainee apprenticeship opportunities to apply for in the bank.

Summary Of Responsibilities
12-week internship plan, including; various face to face training and online training to help build the necessary skills to work in the finance industry
Undertake a corporate challenge that is linked to Corporate Social Responsibility to work on with other interns across the company, will then be expected to deliver to Senior Management at the end of the program.
Provide administrative support to the team.
Involvement with any adhoc projects the team are working on.
Shadow colleagues to gain a better understanding of the business proposition and operations
Must seek advice in case of doubt
Perform all duties in accordance with the principles outlined in the SGP Code of Conduct, as well as the policies and procedures relevant to your responsibilities. To ensure that you adhere to a culture that treats clients fairly and focuses on the long-term sustainability of client relationship.


Profile Required

Competencies
Individual contributor competencies as defined in the SG Leadership Model
Knowledge of business processes, standards, policies and procedures
Verbal and written communication skills
Numeracy
Word, Excel, PowerPoint and other relevant IT skills
Knowledge of regulations applying to the bank, its staff and our clients
Knowledge of internal risk management, compliance, AML procedures and constant vigilance in respect of them
Reliability and attention to detail
Strong interpersonal and client relationship building skills
Team Player & Collaboration
Exercise good judgement skills to prevent fraud and raise alerts as necessary


Work Experience

Previous internships in the financial services is desirable but not essential

EDUCATION

University degree: 2:1 or above

Strong academic achievement

LANGUAGES
Only applicable if the job holder is to work on an international team

Why join us

People join for the impact they can have on us. They stay for the impact we have on them. A flatter structure offers visibility and exposure beyond that of our competitors, so you know our names, and we know yours. It's personable, human, and inspires success through passion. By encouraging open mindedness and a willingness to share ideas, we have adapted to market changes and thrived through innovation. Bringing words like “hard work” and “dedication” together with “community” and “respect” has enabled us to work collaboratively and build our future together. We call this Team Spirit and it's what makes us different. It's what makes you different.

Business insight

If you feel you have the required experience and qualifications, then please apply to the SG Resourcing Team, and we will manage your application. At Société Générale, we believe our people are our strength and are core to the success of our business. As such, we search for, recruit and appoint the best available person on the basis of aptitude and ability, regardless of sex, marital or civil partnership status, race, colour, nationality, ethnic or national origins, pregnancy, disability, age, sexual orientation, religion, belief or gender reassignment.

title: Relationship Management Intern
requirements:
Description

At First Republic, we care about our people. Founded in 1985, we offer extraordinary client service in private banking, private business banking and private wealth management. We believe that personal connections are everything and our success is driven by the relationships we form with our colleagues and clients. You'll always feel empowered and valued here.

Putting you first
As an intern, you will gain hands-on experience at a high-growth company that values its people. You'll earn a competitive starting wage while absorbing a culture that emphasizes collaboration, entrepreneurial thinking and quick decision-making. Start doing the best work of your life here.

Responsibilities

Relationship Management
As an intern, you'll work closely with Relationship Managers and Bankers with their day-today tasks, with a focus on taking care of existing clients and supporting new client relationships. You will gain exposure to other departments as you partner with them to deliver extraordinary service to our clients.

What You'll Do As a Relationship Management Intern
Provide direct support to Relationship Managers on administrative duties related to portfolio management.
Collaborate with marketing to leveraging existing client touchpoints, from events to holiday cards to marketing mailers.
Partner with our Eagle Intelligence team to identify new ways to serve our existing clients.
Help track results from business development efforts using a variety of tools.
Assist with administrative tasks including but not limited to business expense requests, team event planning and list management.
Qualifications

You could be a great fit if you have:
Service-centered mindset with an ability to problem-solve independently and collaborate effectively with others.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Superior attention to detail and ability to manage multiple tasks concurrently.
Discretion with confidential information.
Proficient in Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel).
Two years of undergraduate experience in finance, economics, business administration or similar
Job Demands
Must be able to review and analyze data reports and manuals; must be computer proficient.
Must be able to communicate effectively via telephone and in person.
Own your work and your career - apply now
Are you willing to take initiative and make decisions? Are you willing to go the extra mile because you love what you do and how you can contribute as a team? Do you want the freedom to grow and the opportunity to take charge of your own career? If so, then come join us.

We want hard working team players. You'll have the independence to learn, lead and drive change. A culture of extraordinary service, empowerment and stability - that's the First Republic way.

This job description is not intended to be all-inclusive. Employee may perform other related duties as assigned to meet the ongoing needs of the organization. The Company is an equal opportunity employer. In this regard, the Company makes reasonable accommodations for qualified applicants and employees with disabilities in order to enable them to perform all essential job functions, unless doing so creates an undue hardship.

First Republic is subject to federal laws that restrict the employment of individuals with certain types of criminal histories, including FDIA Section 19 and FINRA. To the extent not inconsistent with our obligations under those federal laws and regulations, First Republic will consider qualified candidates with criminal histories in a manner consistent with the Los Angeles and San Francisco ban-the-box laws.

title: IMA Intern (Wealth Management)
requirements:
Interns at IMA are a big deal. We provide you with opportunities to do real work that drives real results within your department, with our clients, and across IMA! Our interns build client facing materials, analyze company-wide reports, attend vendor meetings, travel to other offices and client sites, and some have even gotten to take pitching lessons from the Rockies. When the summer is over, they have an expertly bound book highlighting their experiences. And it’s paid!

As an Intern, you are introduced to IMA and how we counsel our clients on insurance coverage, employee engagement, financial planning and more. You will have the chance to partner with multiple teams over the course of a 10-12-week program.

Summer Internship Includes
A range of work assignments and professional exposure inside an insurance brokerage
Rotations on different teams for multifaceted learning opportunities and skill development
Assignment to internal mentors as resources to guide you through your summer experience
You will gain a detailed understanding of the insurance industry and how it operates, including a basic understanding of
Marketing - Assist with proposal/presentation materials
Analysis - Review and compare quotes based upon cost, network and benefits
Claims Reporting - Analyzing data from carriers
Funding options - Fully Insured, Partially Funded, Self-Funded

You Will Be Asked To
Perform research and analyze data
Attend business meetings and client meetings
Draft reports
Develop presentation materials
Build and deliver a final presentation of your internship experience to senior leadership
Currently pursuing a college degree. Students graduating in 2021 will be given preference
Previous work or internship experience in human resources, insurance, benefits departments, or similar maybe helpful but not required
An entrepreneurial spirit with the ability to problem-solve, think critically, and provide creative solutions

title: Wealth Management Summer Intern (Twickenham)
requirements:
Summary Of Position

The Summer Internship Program is a 10-week long program with the aim to deliver high-caliber professionals and future leaders, through project work, on-the-job training and related development.

As an intern, you will participate in development meetings, a variety of networking, mentoring and community events, all intended to reinforce the Core Values of the Program - Education, Innovation, Leadership, Collaboration and Service.

The position is full time for the 10 weeks and is a paid non-exempt position.

Internship Description
Effectively interface with Twickenham's Leadership Team
Prepare portfolio reviews for client meetings
Assist with the quantitative analysis of Twickenham's internal portfolio management strategies (i.e., review equity research, update stock rankings models)
Take ownership of individual projects as assigned by Wealth Management team(s) and drive projects to completion
Participate in meetings across the entire team and prepare related follow-up items as needed
Research and prepare data for Monday morning updates
Participate in portfolio presentation for end of internship project

Qualifications

Our 10-week summer internship program focuses on hiring rising senior undergraduate students who meet most or all of the following (depending on the role):
Current full-time undergraduate student with a preferred GPA of 3.0 or above
You are pursuing a Bachelor's degree in a related discipline
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Microsoft Excel
Knowledge of Morningstar, Bloomberg, FactSet is a plus
Excellent problem solving and trouble-shooting skills
Ability to work independently and adapt quickly to new technologies/systems
Strong sense of personal courage and development
Ability to be flexible, resourceful, quick to learn and adapt to change
Solid written and active communication skills
You are a U.S. citizen, U.S. permanent resident or possess other unrestricted U.S. work authorization and will not require sponsorship for U.S. work authorization now or anytime in the future

Apply Now

title: Distribution & Marketing Internship - Summer 2021
requirements:
Company Description

William Blair is a premier global boutique with expertise in investment banking, investment management, and private wealth management. We are committed to building enduring relationships with our clients and providing expertise and solutions to meet their evolving needs. An independent and employee-owned firm, William Blair is headquartered in Chicago and, together with its strategic partners, operates in more than 20 offices worldwide.

Job Summary & Responsibilities

We are offering the unique opportunity to complete an intern program within our US Distribution & Marketing Teams. Our fast paced, hands on internship program will provide first-hand experience in the investment world.

Projects Include
Client Service: Support for cross-sell plans for top clients (researching public data)
Institutional Sales: Support for direct client opportunities (researching public data)
Advisor Solutions: Data cleansing, assistance in developing focus lists for internal sales associates, vendor overlap analysis
Product: Tableau holdings (data intelligence), dashboard for PMs, sub-advisory fee research, product research
Marketing: Client Journey Mapping in conjunction with Digital Working Group, analysis (and reporting/visualization) of marketing campaign data, structure mapping around databases

Be ready to roll up your sleeves among industry leading sales and marketing professionals while gaining insight into sales and client relationship management, and to William Blair’s corporate culture.

The internships will be based in Chicago and lasts approximately 6 weeks. The start date will be early June 2021.

Qualifications
Currently pursuing a Bachelor’s degree, rising juniors preferred.
Ability to work full-time for 6 weeks during the summer.
Academic excellence (GPA of 3.5 or higher) and community involvement.
General understanding of accounting and finance required.
Passion for the financial services industry and sales and marketing.
Strong analytical and leadership skills.
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills.
Strong computer skills including Microsoft Office, specifically Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
Adaptability to manage through change, with a high-degree of emotional maturity.
Highly motivated, detail-oriented, and a team player.

title: Intern, Data Science
requirements:
Description

Position at SoFi

Are you looking for an internship where you will be given meaningful work? Mentorship? Personal and professional development? If so, then SoFi's internship program is the right place for you. Join us for a unique 11-week paid internship that will help shape your career. This is an exciting role for someone to make a direct impact on the company.

At SoFi, you’ll become part of a new kind of finance company whose ambition is to help our members achieve financial independence and reach their goals. We aim to be at the center of our members’ financial lives, and to help every member get their money right. We created student loan refinancing, addressing the biggest financial challenge of a new generation through a modern approach to lending and personal finance. Next we expanded our products and services across loans, wealth management, and insurance. SoFi has achieved significant growth, with ambitious plans ahead, but to continue this growth we need great talent. And that starts with you.

What You'll Do

We are seeking an Intern Data Scientist to join Data Organization in the Engineering department. This is an exciting role for someone to make direct impact on the company financial performance and customer experience. You will be working closely with a world-class team of data scientists and business leaders to help SoFi develop, implement and continuously improve statistical and machine learning models.

What You'll Need
Currently pursuing a Master’s or Ph.D. in Computer Science, Statistics, Operations Research, Engineering, Mathematics or a related quantitative field
Proven ability to assume a strong sense of responsibility and ownership amidst ambiguity
Proven ability to handle challenging tasks and to multi-task
Preferred experience building models in financial services industry
Good knowledge of machine learning and statistical modeling methods for supervised and unsupervised learning
Programming skills in Python and R;
Ability to work in a dynamic, cross-functional environment, with a strong attention to detail
Effective communication skills and ability to explain complex models in simple terms;
Strong relationship building and collaborative skills

Internship Perks
Experience SoFi's dynamic & fast-growing environment
Valuable experience to prepare you for future roles in FinTech, entrepreneurship, startups, or your preferred function
Lunch stipend
Relocation assistance
Fully stocked kitchen (snacks & drinks)

SoFi provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion (including religious dress and grooming practices), sex (including pregnancy, childbirth and related medical conditions, breastfeeding, and conditions related to breastfeeding), gender, gender identity, gender expression, national origin, ancestry, age (40 or over), physical or medical disability, medical condition, marital status, registered domestic partner status, sexual orientation, genetic information, military and/or veteran status, or any other basis prohibited by applicable state or federal law.

Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

SoFi does not seek salary history information from job applicants.

title: Intern
requirements:
Retail Administration
The Retail Administration Department supports PGB’s 19 Retail Branches and assists with all areas of branch operations, compliance and branch security. The Retail Administration Department works with every department and a RA Intern will have exposure to the processes and operations of many business lines throughout the bank. The RA Intern must be flexible and able to assist in any type of emergency throughout the branches.
Duties as a Retail Administration intern would include maintaining the confidentiality of the Bank and it’s clients, preparing letters of correspondence for the department, compiling & organizing branch reports, answering branch employee questions within the scope of responsibilities, and maintaining a weekly report that surveys our interest rate competition across local banks- this is integral information to the bank that is provided to executives to make business decisions.


Commercial Banking
Our Commercial Private Bankers, who specialize in Commercial and Industrial (C&I), Commercial Real Estate, Multi-Family and Small Business Administration lending, provide customized solutions for each transaction, focusing on helping clients achieve their goals. From acquisition, equipment, working capital and owner occupied real estate financing, we provide solutions designed specifically to fit your needs, not ours. What do we focus on? Building long term relationships and helping clients build their legacy. Credit/Underwriting
A. participate in C&I zoom calls with prospects, clients, COIS while documenting all calls for the bankers in banksite
Assist SBA team with banksite pipeline updates as they are short staffed. General Banksite pipe updates for me and other bankers in LOB as well
Assist in annual reviews in assisting both banker and underwriting in this important compliance task occurs
Real Estate visits for annual site reviews of the physical properties
Basic review and understanding of the credit process from beginning to end
Shadowing Me and Stu as well as bankers throughout the process to see what a day in the life is


SBA Loan Department

The SBA Team currently consists of 3 individuals and one Banker Development Associate. We provide SBA loans and service our clients through the pre-closing, closing and post-closing stage of the loan, in addition to other duties required by each respective position.

Interns would be exposed to all aspects of each loan stage by supporting the SBA Team as well as interacting with other departments of the Bank. Other departments include but are not limited to Loan Operations and Retail Banking.

In addition, interns also prepare day to day reports and assist with various systems such as Silverlake/Xperience, Microsoft Office, Microsoft Teams and Zoom. Interns are also required to communicate with clients, when needed, and occasionally go onsite visits.

Information Technology

Information Technology is a critical part of bank operations across all business lines. IT deploys, manages, and supports the bank’s technology solutions.

An Information Technology intern will learn about the various technology platforms and infrastructure used within a bank. Through supporting bank wide technology, an IT intern will have exposure to the processes of many business lines throughout the bank. An IT intern will also work with the IT team on large projects and learn how to support major technology roll outs.

Platinum Service Team

The Platinum Service Team currently consists of 8 individuals with varied banking experience. We open accounts for and service the bank’s high-net worth client base across all of the bank’s various divisions. Most of the relationships housed with Platinum are from the Commercial & Industrial banking group, followed by Commercial Real Estate and Peapack Private Wealth Management. These relationships can be highly complex and the Team partners with all areas of the bank to setup and service the clients’ needs. The team also prepares various reports for the executive business line heads including a bi-weekly deposit pipeline.

Interns would be exposed to bankers from all divisions as well as the Treasury Management teams, Deposit Operations, Lending and Loan Ops as well as the bank’s executive team through meetings and conference calls. They would also be exposed to various systems like Silverlake/Xperience, OnBoard Deposits, Microsoft Power BI, and the Microsoft Office suite including Teams. The intern would assist the team in opening new accounts, the KYC process, coordinating with Treasury Management and other Ops teams to ensure the client has the services they require. They would also learn about the bank’s product offerings and day-to-day business like wire transfers, client correspondence, compliance and audit guidelines, and the team’s approach to white-glove service. The Platinum Service Team intern would also be responsible for completing documentation request for Enhanced Due Diligence from compliance as well as client experience projects for the team.

Wealth
Peapack Private Wealth Management division includes investment management services provided for individuals and institutions; personal trust services, including services as executor, trustee, administrator, custodian and guardian, and other financial planning, tax preparation and advisory services. Officers from the Peapack Private Wealth Management Division are available to provide wealth management, trust and investment services at the Bank’s headquarters in Bedminster, at private banking locations in Morristown, Princeton and Teaneck, New Jersey and at the Bank’s subsidiaries, PGB Trust & Investments of Delaware, in Greenville, Delaware, Murphy Capital Management, in Gladstone, New Jersey, Quadrant Capital Management in Fairfield, New Jersey and Lassus Wherley in New Providence, New Jersey and Bonita Springs, Florida.

Credit/Underwriting
Commercial banking is divided into two sub-sectors, commercial real estate lending, which involves financing the acquisitions of properties, and commercial and industrial/community banking loans, which help companies get started, expand, and buy equipment. Peapack-Gladstone Bank Credit Risk Management (CRM) is responsible for lending production, underwriting, and closing of investment grade loans and the credit administration of these loan assets thereafter. Loan assets is an important revenue stream for Peapack-Gladstone Bank.
Interns will spread and analyze business. Perform due diligence on prospective clients in order to obtain information used in the preparation of analysis. Attend meetings to discuss commercial credit proposals being presented by Loan Officers. Assist in evaluating proposed loans for credit risk and preparation of loan proposals. Perform due diligence on prospective clients in order to obtain information used in the preparation of analysis. Conduct industry analysis, market analysis, property inspections. Attend loan discussion meetings and assist in the management and monitoring activities of the Commercial/Community Banking loan portfolio.


Electronic Banking

The Electronic Banking Department supports Peapack Gladstone Bank’s digital banking platform and works to operationally support internal and external client needs and enhance the “PGB Client Experience”.

On a daily basis, team members specialize in debit card issuance and maintenance, branch ATM support, online and mobile banking support, client disputes, annual reviews of ACH clients and remote deposit capture, and fraud monitoring.

Additionally, the department supports Peapack Gladstone Bank’s ‘Digital Strategic Initiative” with projects that include replacement of the entire fleet of ATM’s, upgrading of the online and mobile consumer banking platforms and incorporation of Zelle as a form of electronic payment processing for PGB Clients. These initiatives allow PGB to expand the digital functionality of our products and enhance our client’s banking experience.

During an interns time in Electronic Banking, they can expect to be remotely exposed to daily functions which will include: daily fraud monitoring, debit card and online banking issues and resolution and will focus heavily on supporting the Electronic Banking Supervisor with annual compliance and NACHA regulated reviews of ACH originating clients.

ERM and Regulatory Compliance

ERM

Enterprise risk management (ERM) is the Bank’s enterprise risk competence—the ability to understand, control, and articulate the nature and level of risks taken in pursuit of business strategies—coupled with accountability for risks taken and activities engaged in. One of the main benefits of ERM is an enhanced perspective and focus on risk management across the institution. The changing regulatory environment, economic turmoil, and growing complexity of products, tools, and risks has, among other influences, helped to launch the practice of enterprise risk management into the financial services area. By definition, the business of banking exposes the organization to a wide variety of risks. The ERM framework is designed to support the depth and breadth of activities by providing a structured approach for identifying, measuring, controlling, and reporting on the significant risks faced by an organization. Specific risk management (e.g., credit, operational, market), capital management, and liquidity management provide the essential underpinnings to an ERM framework. ERM is the governance structure that provides the horizontal view of the risk disciplines and operational risks of an institution.

Enterprise Risk Management (ERM) is defined as an organization’s ability to understand, control, and articulate the nature and level of risks taken in pursuit of business strategies, coupled with accountability for risks taken and activities engaged in. One of the main benefits of ERM is an enhanced perspective and focus on risk management across the institution.

Regulatory Compliance

Various consumer protection, fair lending, fair housing, and community reinvestment laws apply to financial institutions’ interactions with customers and communities. The Regulatory Compliance Department is responsible for overseeing the Bank’s compliance with all applicable laws and regulations established by Congress and the federal and state regulatory agencies, including the Bank Secrecy Act and Anti-Money Laundering (AML) Regulations, Office of Foreign Asset Control (OFAC), and Community Reinvestment Act (CRA).

title: Wealth Management Investment Intern
requirements:

Wednesday, March 17, 2021

Washington Trust is a special place because of our people. We believe employees who are valued, recognized, rewarded and empowered will achieve personal and professional goals. We hire the best people in the business and are always looking for professionals who will uphold our core values of quality, integrity and community.
Washington Trust is looking for an Intern to participate with its Wealth Management Investment Research team for the summer (May - August). This is an excellent opportunity for college students to participate in investment analysis and research projects in a professional Wealth Management environment.

Applicants should be entering their senior year of college with a degree in Finance or similar business related field, with experience in investment analysis through school organizations or previous internships. This opportunity requires proficiency in Microsoft products...
